com.mvohm.quadruple.test

Class DataGenerators.Randoms

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mvohm.quadruple.test.DataGenerators.Randoms
  • Enclosing class:
    DataGenerators

    static class DataGenerators.Randoms
extends Object
    The methods of this class generate random values and various random sequences, including lists of pairs of random values suitable for testing binary operations

      • simpleRandomsWithNulls

        public static List<String> simpleRandomsWithNulls(int count)
        Generates and returns a list of string representations of random BigDecimal values that fall within the range valid for Quadruple.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the generated list, with nulls inserted after each item

      • randDoublesWithHalfLSB

        public static List<String> randDoublesWithHalfLSB(int count)
        Generates and returns a list with string representations of random BigDecimal values that fall within the range valid for @code double}, such that the mantissa of each value differs from the mantissa of the nearest double value by 1^-53 (half of least significant bit of the double's mantissa) or by 1^-53 - 1^-128. Used to test the correctness of the rounding performed during the conversion from Quadruple to double.
        Parameters:
        count - the amount of random numbers to be generated
        Returns:
        the generated list, with nulls inserted after each item

      • randQuadruplesWithHalfLSB

        public static List<String> randQuadruplesWithHalfLSB(int count,
                                                     int expOfDelta)
        Generates and returns a list of strings with pairs of BigDecimal values that fall within the range valid for Quadruple. The first item of each pair is a random BigDecimal value such that its mantissa differs from the mantissa of the nearest Quadruple value by
        2^-129 - 2^(-129 + expOfDelta),
        and the mantissa of the second value differs from the mantissa of the same Quadruple value by
        2^-129.
        In other words, the first value of the pair can be written as
        (1 + (n + 0.5 - 2^(expOfDelta-1)) * 2^-128) * 2^N,
        and the second one can be written as
        (1 + (n + 0.5) * 2^-128) * 2^N.
        During the conversion from BigDecimal to Quadruple the first value should get rounded down to (1 + n * 2^-128) * 2^N, and the second should get rounded up to (1 + (n + 1) * 2^-128) * 2^N.
        Used to test the correctness of the rounding performed during the conversion from BigDecimal to Quadruple.
        Parameters:
        count - the amount of random numbers to be generated
        expOfDelta - exponent of the power of two that should be subtracted from the LSB of the mantissa of the first value of the pair
        Returns:
        the generated list, with nulls inserted after each value

      • randDoubles

        public static List<String> randDoubles(int count)
        Generates and returns a list of strings representing random Quadruple values falling within the range valid for doubles.

      • randomsForAddition

        public static List<String> randomsForAddition(int count)
        Returns a list of pairs of random values, with null after each pair. The values of the items in each pair are concerted so that their addition makes sense in most cases (i.e. the expected result does not equal to one of the operands and is not Infinity)
        Parameters:
        count - the number of pairs to generate
        Returns:
        a list of strings, containing string representations of the generated pairs of values, with nulls inserted after each pair

      • randomsForMultiplication

        public static List<String> randomsForMultiplication(int count)
        Returns a list of pairs of random values, with null after each pair. The values of the items in each pair are concerted so that their multiplication makes sense in most cases (i.e. the expected result is rarely equal to 0 or Infinity).
        Parameters:
        count - the number of pairs to generate
        Returns:
        a list of strings, containing string representations of the generated pairs of values, with nulls inserted after each pair

      • randomsForDivision

        public static List<String> randomsForDivision(int count)
        Returns a list of pairs of random values, with null after each pair. The values of the items in each pair are concerted so that division makes sense in most cases (i.e. the expected result is rarely equal to 0 or Infinity)
        Parameters:
        count - the number of pairs to generate
        Returns:
        a list of strings, containing string representations of the generated pairs of values, with nulls inserted after each pair
